discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Enabling a Holistic Approach

"What’s in the exam? Candidates will explore COBIT concepts, principles and methodologies used to establish, enhance, and maintain a system for effective governance and management of enterprise information technology. The exam will test a candidate’s understanding of those topics. Individuals who achieve a passing score on the COBIT 2019 Foundation exam will receive the COBIT 2019 Foundation Certificate."

Questions will review COBIT 2019 Foundation from website notes
is this the foundation exam of COBIT 5 ?
Six Principles for a Governance System

questions.question_text: Which principle is key for the governance and management of enterprise IT?

choices.C: Aligning with internal IT policies and procedures

discussion.content:
From the ISACA COBIT framework intro:
A governance framework should be open and flexible. It should allow the addition of new content and the ability
to address new issues in the most flexible way, while maintaining integrity and consistency

questions.question_text: According to the principles for a governance framework, which of the following is a PRIMARY consideration when addressing new issues within a flexible and open framework?

discussion.content:
C.
From ISACA COBIT foundation doc: "Flexibility and openness—The definition and use of design factors allow COBIT to be tailored for better
alignment with a user’s particular context. The COBIT open architecture enables adding new focus areas (see
section 4.4) or modifying existing ones, without direct implications for the structure and content of the COBIT
core model."

questions.question_text: How does the flexibility of COBIT design factors benefit an enterprise?

choices.B: It allows users to define and build the enterprise IT strategy from the framework
choices.A: It allows users to modify existing focus areas while ensuring new ones cannot be added
choices.C: At allows users to tailor the framework to align with specific enterprise needs

discussion.content:
B.

questions.question_text: Which COBIT domain of management objectives incorporates managed business process controls?
Which mechanism is NOT considered to be a good practice of Organizational Structures?

discussion.content: Framework Introduction and Methodology - CH6 - Performance Management of Organizational Structures
